result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Lee Bullock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6.36 to be paid to A&S Gas n Go.

- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- NO DNA SAMPLE or DNA SURCHARGE ordered on Count 2 as it has been ordered on Count 1.  
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.

*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  A&S Gas n Go, Vicky B., Carrie J.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Referral to the mental health unit.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED these days to be used at the probation agents discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Lee Bullock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

COUNTS 1 AND 2 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of  2 years with the following conditions:  

AS TO EACH COUNT:
*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED these days to be used at the probation agents discretion.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  A&S Gas n Go, Vicky B., Carrie J.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Referral to the mental health unit.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $6.36 to be paid to A&S Gas n Go.

- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- NO DNA SAMPLE or DNA SURCHARGE ordered on Count 2 as it has been ordered on Count 1.  
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Alexis Liggins for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings.  Defense counsel requests new date when counsel can be present.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with A & S Gas N Go.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  The state is not prepared to proceed to sentencing today.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.      Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

file stamped August 17, 2015.  Count 1:  Criminal Damage to Property (less than $2500 damage), contrary to sec. 943.01(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor. Count 2:  Theft (Value not exceeding $2500), contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  The state is not ready to proceed today, assigned ADA is not available and negotiations are unclear.  The Court grants state's motion to adjourn.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed,  Count 1:  Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, contrary to sec.  943.23(5), 939.50(3)(i) Wis. Stats, a Class I Felony.  Count 2:  Theft, contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.  a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defense counsel needs additional time to review plea paperwork with her client and asked that cases 15CF3748 and 15CF1566 be heard tomorrow December 4, 2015.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea hearing on December 4, 2015 at 8:30 in Branch 26.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed, parties notifed for pickup.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  The Court suspended proceedings.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Defense in contest posture and request jury trial.  State withdraws offer for deferred prosecution.  Dates selected with the parties.  Filed, signed Felony Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Defense counsel needs additional time and requests new date.    DPA Hearing adjourned in Branch 26.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court takes no action as to bail at this time.  Case adjourned for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 26.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  The Court ordered no bail forfeited at this time.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Paige Styler for attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: 3232 N 26th Street, Milwaukee WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Brandon Lee Bullock in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
